column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////The ramen. The toppings are very good
column2: on par with other hot ramen spots. The broth has good flavor
column4: it is not nearly as full and rich as other ramen places. It's almost oily and pretty watered down. I have to get the garlic broth instead of just the regular tonkatsu in order to taste much. And on top of the broth
column5: I'm just not a big fan of the noodles. I'm not a ramen expert or anything
column6: but they have almost a rubbery consistency..kind of reminds me of gnocchi
column7: which I don't think ramen noodles are supposed to be like. Don't get me wrong
column8: I actually do still enjoy it
column9: but it's just not up to par with other ramen establishments.
